p: Finally, (v) the methanolic extract of the South African plant Sclerocarya birrea (A.Rich.) Hoch. (trunk bark; Anacardiaceae) has been proposed to exhibit anti-QS activity as it inhibits the production of pyoverdine, protease and motility as well as biofilm formation (78% inhibition) in P. aeruginosa MTCC 2453 at the concentration of 100 Âµg/mL [ 53].
